result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Joseph Edgeberg

records.addlTxt: Status conference on March 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 3, 2023 at 10:30 am.

1:47 PM Defendant Adam Joseph Edgeberg in court in custody from DCJ.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for Adam Joseph Edgeberg.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
18CF381, 18CT128, 21CF277, 21CF296, 21CF323, 22CF35

21CF296 - ARGN
Atty Perrin - rcvd Information, waive reading. Understands charges and penalties. Enters Not Guilty pleas.

21CF323 - ARGN
Atty Perrin - rcvd Information, waive reading. Understands charges and penalties. Enters Not Guilty pleas.

22CF35 - ARGN
Atty Perrin - rcvd Information, waive reading. Understands charges and penalties. Enters Not Guilty pleas.

Atty Perrin - asks that these cases be set as a status hearing along with the FPT and JT in 18CF381
State - no objection
Court - sets 21CF296, 21CF323, 22CF35 for a status hearing on 3/3/23 at 10:30 AM.
Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Inmate Fax re: apology to the Court

2:12 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam Joseph Edgeberg in court in custody from Dunn County jail.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for Adam Joseph Edgeberg. B. Bahr - Clerk 
18CF381, 18CT128, 21CF277, 21CF296, 21CF323, 22CF35

21CF296 - Preliminary hearing
2:15 PM State calls Lt. Kelly Pollock. Witness is sworn in and testifies. Witness identifies defendant.
Atty Perrin - cross examines witness
2:20 PM witness is excused
State - asks court to find probable cause and bind over
Court - finds probable cause and binds DE over

21CF323 - Preliminary hearing
2:21 PM State calls Deputy Greg Moen. Witness is sworn in and testifies. Witness identifies defendant.
Atty Perrin - no cross. no argument
2:28 PM witness is excused
State - asks court to find probable cause and bind over
Court - finds probable cause and binds DE over

22CF35 - Preliminary hearing
2:29 PM State calls Deputy Greg Moen. Witness is sworn in and testifies. Witness previously identifies defendant
Court - takes notice of previous identification of defendant
Atty Perrin - cross examines
2:33 PM witness is excused
State - asks court to find probable cause and bind over
Atty Perrin - argues. Asks court to deny bind over
Court - finds probable cause and binds DE over. Sets ARGN for all three cases. Remaining cases to be set as status.

18CF381 - set for trial
State - set for 2 day trial
Atty Perrin - agrees 2 days are needed
Court - contacts analysist for scheduling. Trial set for March 13 & 14, 2023. #1 with Analysist.  Attorneys to appear at 8:30 AM. Jury selection begins at 9:00 AM. FPT March 3, 2023 at 10:30 AM.    Filings due on or before Feb 17, 2023.
Arraignment scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam Joseph Edgeberg in court in custody from Dunn County jail.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin appeared by video for Adam Joseph Edgeberg. B. Bahr - Clerk 
18CF381, 21CF277, 21CF323, 22CF35, 18CT128, 21CF296


18CF381, 21CF277, 21CF323, 22CF35 - bond hearing
18CT128, 21CF296 - status hearing

Atty Perrin - asks for $2,500 cash across the board on bonds. Would like to go to treatment. On probation in MN.
State - objects to modifying any of the bonds. Many pending Felony cases that have very serious charges. Absconded and fought extradition. 
Atty Perrin - argues for lower cash bond.
Court - denies request for bond modification on Branch 3 cases. Bond remains. 
State - speaks to the status of these cases. Prelim needs to be held in 21CF323 and 21CF296. INIT in 22CF35
Atty Perrin - was just appointed yesterday. Needs time to go over cases. Will waive speedy prelims. 
Court - set 21CF323, 21CF296 and 22CF35 for preliminary hearings on August 5 at 2pm. Other cases will tag along as status hearings.

22CF35 - INIT
State - 22CF35 needs to have the INIT yet.
Atty Perrin - does not have that complaint yet.
Court - provides copy of complaint to defendant. Goes over charges and penalties.
Atty Perrin - waives reading.
Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Letter to Court RE: Attorney Schedule
Bail/bond hearing on June 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Fax from Defendant Requesting Bond Hearing

1:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam Joseph Edgeberg appeared by video, in custody from the Dunn County Jail, without counsel. A. Standaert - Clerk 

18CF381, 21CF277, 21CF323, 22CF35

Court - has recused herself on case 18CF381, will not hear it today
Deft - makes argument for request of high sign or low cash bond, asks for psych eval
State - makes argument, objects to modification of bonds
Court - continues bond in 21CF277, continues bond in 21CF323, continues bond in 22CF35 - not ordering psychological eval, asks deft to make that request in writing
Bail/bond hearing on June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Inmate Fax RE: request for bond hearing

1:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam Joseph Edgeberg appeared by video from DC Jail. Attorney Jonathan Lundeen appears by Zoom. V. Girard - Clerk 
21CF333, 21CF213, 21CF190, 21CF189, 21CF188, 19CF394, 18CT128, 18CF381, 22CF35, 21CF323, 21CF296, 21CF277
State - Deft has 12 pending files in Dunn Co, and in surrounding counties- bonds have been increased & then modified to go to treatment - was ordered to turn himself in - is flight risk - no bonds have been forfeited that aware of - asking for 22CF35 $5000 cash, 21CF323 $10,000 cash bond, in 18CF381 $10,000 cash bond, in 21CF296 $1,000 cash bond & 21CF277 $1,000 cash bond
Atty Lundeen - is trying to move to MN - bond amts requesting is unreasonable to ensure appearances
Court - has demonstrated he is a big flight risk - has a lot of cash posted - State's request are reasonable.
  , in 18CF381 $10,000 cash bond modified from $3000 cash - needs additional $7000 posted, 21CF35 orders $5,000 cash bail, 21CF323 orders $10,000 cash bail, 21CF296 orders $1,000 cash bail, and in 
  21CF277 orders amended bond from sign bond to $1,000 cash bond - total would be an additional $24,000 posted
  Quash all warrants
Bond in 18CF381 has been forfeited so will need to pay entire amount of $10,000 cash in that file.
Dates given for status  Br 2 6/3 at 11:30 am & Br 3 6/23 at 2:15 pm
Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
